tweets.html:
The new commercial where the dad says "Lets have a BBQ!" and the kids get excited and he takes them to Burger King makes me deeply sad.

— Paula Pell (@perlapell) July 9, 2012

What I want for Christmas: the cast of #SOA re-enacting the Bieber/Gomez viral video for "Call Me Maybe." I'm not asking for much here.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 9, 2012

TomKat divorce settled! That was quick. On the paperwork she crossed out "mental cruelty" and wrote in "Rock of Ages"

— Bill Maher (@billmaher) July 9, 2012

The more I read about the Katie Holmes settlement, the more I realize that Katie Holmes is Michael Corleone from The Godfather.

— Holiday nom de plume (@JakesAlterEgo) July 10, 2012

Hoping TREME runs long enough for its finale to end w all the characters watching BP spill coverage on NEWSNIGHT WITH WILL MCAVOY.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 9, 2012

HBO's "The Newsroom" conquers two major demographics: beleaguered former network news anchors age 50-75, Sam Waterston revivalists age 18-49

— Mattheim Sussroller (@suss2hyphens) July 9, 2012

Noticing that conversations in my newsroom are slower and nowhere nearly as well written as they are in #TheNewsroom. Also, less walking.

— Mark Joyella (@standupkid) July 9, 2012

So far, being a Nielsen family has meant me chasing my wife around w/ a diary asking her exactly when and how she watched TV.

— Kyle S. Barnett (@kylesbarnett) July 9, 2012

Every plot on The Newsroom is "Alison Pill looks surprised."

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) July 10, 2012

It must be so exciting for Olivia Munn to not be the main problem with #Newsroom!

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) July 10, 2012

My blog's stats suggest that CHUCK is now a major hit in India.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) July 9, 2012

We've just started following @MNightShyamalan. The twist is, we were following him all along.

— Empire Magazine (@empiremagazine) July 10, 2012

Do ppl really give enough of a damn ab mike and Ike to make a commercial ab them breaking up. This ain't Tom and Katie y'all. This candy.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) July 10, 2012

It's Fred Savage's birthday. When he blows out the candles, Daniel Stern makes a wish in his head.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) July 10, 2012

Trying to decide whether to pray for the meteor to hit San Diego during the Glee panel or the True Blood panel is giving me a headache.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 10, 2012

Nothing will make you appreciate an hour of Bunheads like the last 15 minutes of Secret Life Of The American Teenager.

— Erik Adams (@ErikMAdams) July 10, 2012

Sometimes I think lovely @DamonLindelof's middle name is "Piñata". :-(

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) July 10, 2012

Seriously, whatever you think about Damon Lindelof he has a damn good sense of humor about himself.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 10, 2012

@TVandDinners He and Jorge Garcia really ought to do a sitcom together.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) July 10, 2012

I hope @DamonLindelof never ruins any book, movie, or tv show that I love.

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) July 10, 2012

As always, on twitter, the need to explain joke: I am huge @DamonLindelof fan. He didn't ruin anything. But he did break my heart...

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) July 10, 2012

Ok, if McConaughey doesn't get an Oscar for Magic Mike, then they need to invent a new award called The McConaughey for Best McConaughey.

— Stuart Berman (@stuberman) July 10, 2012

When I play Glass House my finishing move is going to be picking and flicking a booger.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 10, 2012

Wife: "I hope you're at least planning on writing a paper on Glass House...Because I'm trying to figure out why you're watching this..."

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 10, 2012

how many damn letters have been written this season?! #Bachelorette

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 10, 2012

Helicopter ride! Is this the first one of the season? That would be an outrage. #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 10, 2012

The obligatory helicopter of romance. Drink. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 10, 2012

So Sean finally gets out the L world. Em sounds as enthusiastic as if she’s gotten a two-for-one Fro-Yo coupon. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 10, 2012

FINALLY A BACHELORETTE WHOSE PUSSY IS ON LOCKDOWN!!!!

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) July 10, 2012

but if they moved, Jef would have to quit his job at Hot Topic. #Bachelorette

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 10, 2012

Sean thinks "Fantasy Date" means he gets to stay up and talk. What man's fantasy is more talking?? #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 10, 2012

“Arie doesn’t just tell me he likes me. He shows me that.” Mostly with his tongue. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 10, 2012

Emily: "I could keep you out of trouble, and you could get me into trouble!" She just admitted their life would be a sitcom. #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 10, 2012

“I'm falling in love in different ways.” Think she means “in different places.” If you know what I’m saying. #andithinkyoudo #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) July 10, 2012

Just spelled One-F Jef with two F's. I am a failure as a live tweeter. #Bachelorette

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) July 10, 2012

NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 10, 2012

I'm completely heartbroken. And overly invested in the outcome of this reality show. #TheBachelorette

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) July 10, 2012

@cassiebelek You know, if I wasn't watching a bunch of guys take batting practice, I'd probably question your TV habits.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) July 10, 2012

I will now live-tweet every insightful or funny thing Chris Berman says during the Home Run Derby.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 10, 2012

Chris Berman: "Our lineup tonight brought to you by Taco Bell, not George 'Taco' Bell, but Taco Bell." Mother of God...

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 10, 2012

The #HomeRunDerby. Programming the "Mute" button was made for...

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) July 10, 2012

Join @OnionSports as we live tweet the first round of the 2012 MLB Home Run Derby.

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

That’s a home run

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

Is this going to be the glorious night when Berman's revolting shtick finally gives him a fatal aneurism?

— Hire Jim Essian (@hirejimessian) July 10, 2012

Home run again

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

#HRDerby Is this about Human Resources? It will seem like a game, but just be a series of exercises about diversity and sexual harassment?

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) July 10, 2012

More home runs

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

Berman saying "And I thought this was the Year of the Pitcher" during a Home Run Derby could be the dumbest thing he's ever said.

— Erik Malinowski (@erikmal) July 10, 2012

I forgot Bergman does the HR derby. Thank God I didn't forget where the mute button is

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) July 10, 2012

Watching 1st HR Derby with 4 year old. When they showed Prince Fielder in practice cage, he screamed: "He's trapped!"

— Rich Eisen (@richeisen) July 10, 2012

Home run

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

"This one is on its way to Wichita!" Wichita was the 3rd favorite on our board behind Branson and Topeka for Berman's local geography ref.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 10, 2012

One home run

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

I can't wait for Chris Berman's appearance on Newsroom next week.

— Tony Wonder (@Tony_Wonder) July 10, 2012

Kansas City fans did to Robinson Cano what Twitter is doing to Chris Berman... #HRDerby

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) July 10, 2012

No home runs

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

At 9 outs, Cano should have grabbed a mic and promised to donate money to a local charity for every HR, just to see if they'd still boo.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) July 10, 2012

Thank you for following @OnionSports’ live, unbiased coverage of the 2012 MLB Home Run Derby.

— Onion Sports Network (@OnionSports) July 10, 2012

Analysis of the crowd reaction to the Home Run Derby. RT @reidepstein What's dumber than analysis of the Home Run Derby?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 10, 2012

Chris Berman: "Man that one's hit to Omaha!" George Brett: "That's the wrong direction."

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 10, 2012

hey everyone we are minutes away from Chris Berman and Julia Allison going HEAD TO HEAD in the Unlikable People On Cable Ratings Battle

— maura 🎙 johnston (@maura) July 10, 2012

"THAT ONE ALMOST WENT OVER EVERYTHING!" - Chris Berman, on a ball that was 50 feet from going over everything.

— Scott Coleman (@scottcoleman55) July 10, 2012

"Hour three is a bit slow, but in the fourth hour things really get going!"- me convincing a random person to watch the hr derby

— Brandon McCarthy (@BMcCarthy32) July 10, 2012

Manufacturing artificial enthusiasm is the only exercise Chris Berman gets.

— Sigh Hersh (@Ugarles) July 10, 2012

A swing-off in the Home Run Derby is only matched by the drama of an overtime NFL preseason game.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 10, 2012

See, I don't think there should be a swing-off in HR Derby. I think winner of World Series should determine who advances.

— Joe Posnanski (@JPosnanski) July 10, 2012

"WAY BACK!" screams Berman for the shortest homer Trumbo hits all night

— Jason Wojciechowski (@jlwoj) July 10, 2012

I would walk Fielder and pitch to Delmon.

— Mattheim Sussroller (@suss2hyphens) July 10, 2012

Berman's just saying what we're all thinking, I mean those balls are going back pretty far.

— C H I L I (@heyitschili) July 10, 2012

We filleted the day’s catch. Went inside. Heard Chris Berman yelling. Immediately envied the fish.

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) July 10, 2012

John Kruk: "Who ya got, Nomar?" Nomar Garciaparra: "Between these two?" (There are two people remaining in the competition.)

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 10, 2012

Chris Berman more like "Chris BORE-man" right guys #400RTs #250Favs

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 10, 2012

Imagine Chris Berman suffering a series of devastating spinal injuries and then dying. I wonder what the headline would be.

— Ramzy Nasrallah (@ramzy) July 10, 2012

And hey it still beats Berman AM I RIGHT PEOPLE #everytweettonight

— Here's Chris Lambert (@lambertman) July 10, 2012

tweets.author_name: Old Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Hoss Radbourn
tweets.html:
It is nice of "Bud" Selig to employ people with no skill at public speaking to handle MLB's public speaking.

— Old Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Ho Hoss Radbourn (@OldHossRadbourn) July 10, 2012

Somehow, this Dwight Howard trade involves Raef LaFrentz moving into my basement. And I have to send my lawn mower to Utah.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) July 10, 2012

Chord Overstreet is playing for the American League? This really could turn into a Glee hate-tweet fest. #CelebritySoftball

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) July 10, 2012

The #CelebritySoftball game NEEDS to be what determines home field advantage in the World Series.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 10, 2012

When was the last time Mike Sweeney, Bill Self, and CHORD OVERSTREET!!! went back-to-back-to-back? 2010? #CelebritySoftball

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 10, 2012

Don Draper can't handle the hot corner. Time to put in Ginsberg. #CelebritySoftball #MadMen

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) July 10, 2012

THAT'S WHAT THE DH IS FOR!!! RT @jlschaefer: Don Draper can't handle the hot corner. Time to put it in Ginsberg. #CelebritySoftball #MadMen

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 10, 2012

Watching the All-Star Celeb/Legends Softball Game, which I wish had "Hunger Games" rules to spice things up.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 10, 2012

Jon Hamm hits a homer, driving in the go ahead run for Sterling Cooper Draper Pryce against Cutler, Gleason, and Chaough. #CelebritySoftball

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) July 10, 2012

Today on MSNBC's Morning Joe: "OMG! Kids today with their Google & their texts and they have ADHD and they don't make eye contact and OMG!"

— Chuck Tryon (@chutry) July 10, 2012

One of the MSNBC guys actually said, "You don't have to knock on somebody's door anymore because you can just Google that person."

— Chuck Tryon (@chutry) July 10, 2012

IDEA: Human Bark Collar. Every host/guest MUST wear one. When you lie on TV news, you get a spray of citronella in your face live on TV.

— Lizz Winstead (@lizzwinstead) July 10, 2012

I realized today that the main reason I look forward to Justin Timberlake movies is that he goes on Jimmy Fallon's show to promote them.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) July 10, 2012

Some people say multi-cam sitcoms are too jokey. Good thing there are no jokes on Twitter.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) July 10, 2012
